intro: Barleria arnottiana var. arnottiana, commonly known as the red barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink, blooming from late winter to early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant flowers and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
